entry.title: Build the "Tunnel"
entry.content:
Access be blocked by the GFW?

Build a Shadowsocks service on your own

If you donâ€™t want to read the introductions, go to Quick Start directly
Cannot understand English? See Chinese edition here
As President Xi came into power, the Internet access in China has become more and more restrictive. Most foreign websites are blocked in mainland China under the countryâ€™s policy of Internet censorship, which include Google, Youtube, Facebook, Twitter, Wikipedia (CN site) and so on. To visit these websites, you need to break through blockade of GFW.

What is shadowsocks?

Shadowsocks is an open-source encrypted proxy project, widely used in mainland China to circumvent Internet censorship. It was created in 2012 by a Chinese programmer named â€œclowwindyâ€, and multiple implementations of the protocol have been made available since. Typically, the client software will open a socks5 proxy on the machine it is run, which internet traffic can then be directed towards, similarly to an SSH tunnel. Unlike an SSH tunnel, shadowsocks can also proxy UDP traffic. There are several different types of shadowsocks now but all of them are based on socks5 protocol. (Read more in Wikipedia)

What is the different between VPN and SS?

Technically, shadowsocks has nothing to do with VPN. Itâ€™s not a VPN, itâ€™s a proxy. VPN is a virtual network interface which you can send everything through it. Proxy is a server used to forward data to another. There are two mainly difference between them.

  1. To use a proxy, you had to let program know there is a proxy. But you donâ€™t have to config programs to use VPN.
  2. You can transfer any kind of data through VPN. With proxy, only TCP can be delivered. (actually, in some version of shadowsocks, UDP also works)

(Read more in this Quora)

Why is a VPS needed?

Look at the following picture. In the practical use, encrypted data is transferred through the VPS(SS Server) so that the GFW doesnâ€™t know where is the data from, and will naturally allow the data to pass through.

  • Make sure these websites are accessible at the location of your VPS.
  • Make sure the IP address of the VPS havenâ€™t been blocked by the GFW.
  • The shorter the distance between you location and the location of your VPS, the faster your Internet will be.

    • Quick Start

    Buy a VPS

    • BandweagonHost:
             Official Website 1 (be blocked in China)
             Official Website 2
             Chinese Site (not official)

    • Vultr

    • Linode

    • Digital Ocean

    • Please check this link to get more information and suggestions

      • If you know nothing about technology or have difficulty learning about it, please select BandweagonHost KVM versions. Remember to search for discount code before you pay.

      Install BBR

      This step is optional but recommended, because it makes your VPS perform in a higher level. You donâ€™t need this step if you choose Quick install from BandweagonHost. See how to install in this article.

      Install shadowsocks on the VPS

      Quick install from BandweagonHost control panel

      Because of some issues, new buyers cannot install ss from the panel automatically. If you donâ€™t have shadowsocks choice, go to Install from packet by ç§‹æ°´é€¸å†° directly.

      1. Go to BWH services page and click on â€œKiwiVM Control Panelâ€.
      2. Click on the â€œStopâ€ button to shut down the VPS. And Click on the â€œInstall new OSâ€ button on the left.
      3. Choose one of CentOS-6 with bbr and reload it. After reloading, click on the â€œShadowsocks Serverâ€ button on the left and Install Shadowsocks server. After completely installing, go back. Check the encryption method, server port and server password. Change them if you want.

      Install from packet by ç§‹æ°´é€¸å†°

      Reference - offical website of ç§‹æ°´é€¸å†°
      Install Putty on your PC
      (In putty, right click the green box equals to paste, so no need to type word by word)

      1. Open Putty, enter IP address and SSH port of the VPS
      2. If itâ€™s the first time youâ€™ve configured the VPS, you may see a security alert. Just choose Yes when the alert occurs. When it says login in as:, enter root, and you can get the initial password through the KiwiVM control panelâ€“> Root password modification â€“> Generate and set new root password
      3. After login in, you can enter passwd to reset the password as you want, then you donâ€™t have to remember the irregular password generated by the system.

      4. Make sure your VPS has wget command

      5. Enter and configure as your need

      Successful if you get the following and record them:

      Multiuser configuration

      1. find your configuration file, the path might be /etc/shadowsocks.json, it actually depends the version of shadowsocks youâ€™ve installed. So enter vi /etc/shadowsocks.json to edit the configuration file.

      2. Type i to enter the insert mode and write in the configuration file:

        Change the ports and password to what you need

      3. Save it( esc+:wq ) and enter

      Download Client

      • Shadowsocks
        • Win
        • MacOS X
        • Android
        • iOS
      • Shadowsocks-R
        • Win
        • MacOS X
        • Android
        • iOS

      Input your SS service information (encryption method, server port and server password) and start enjoying the Internet without any restrictions.

      Other use of VPS

      If you regard those red or green notes as s**t, just skip this step. But if you want to fully use the VPS you buy, you can download torrents, build a private cloud or even host a website on it.
